messages.message: can someone from this thread help approve the PR?

@Eric Han you would need to test your changes by building the docker container and running a UDF that imports from `foundation`  since that is the main use case. Did you test that? Also can you share reproducible steps to cause this issue? Cause I can run `make clean build runlocal` from `webserver/api-server-apps` successfully, and I did pull from master today
how did you uninstall it? I get `WARNING: Skipping foundation as it is not installed.`  when I do `pip uninstall foundation`

@Dominic Fannjiang what if you try doing running `make clean build runlocal` from `distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks`?

Running `tail celery-app-tasks.log` (in the path I typed out above) gives me this, so maybe you can reproduce this issue with a different service
it’s so weird that this seems to be affecting a lot of frontend ppl but no one else has complained yet

LOL

I don't understand what the ppl being affected by it have in common, because there are also ppl that don't have this bug
alright i just sanity checked with a couple of other ppl who are not frontend, and they’re getting the same error too on latest master
Getting this error as well right now
@Eric Han I see the PR is still failing jenkins. I know the fix and will push it in a minute
just merged in the changes into master!
@Eric Han can you confirm that you can build locally with latest master?
